actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Census and Population.
Committee on Post Office and Civil Service discharged.
Mr. Sawyer asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 1043 proposed by Senator Mitchell.
Amendment SP 1043 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To designate the week beginning September 1, 1991, as "National Campus Crime and Security Awareness Week".

summary.text: Designates the week beginning September 1, 1991, as National Campus Crime and Security Awareness Week. Provides for the appointment of two additional members to the Civil War Sites Advisory Commission.

titles.title: To designate the week beginning September 1, 1991, as "National Campus Crime and Security Awareness Week".
